body: DISTRICT 1 -- Greenpoint, Williamsburg; next meeting, Nov. 18, 7 P.M.; 211 Ainslee Street, corner of Manhattan Avenue; Board President: Vincent Abate; District Manager: Gerald Esposito; (718) 389-0009. title: COMMUNITY BOARDS; Meetings Around Brooklyn, District by District

body: Anticipating that Metrocards will change the way commuters use buses and subways, transit officials said yesterday that they would cut bus service on several major north-south routes in Manhattan, while adding service to crosstown lines and to routes running to the distant reaches of the other boroughs. Schedule changes are planned on nearly 100
title: Officials Plan Cuts or Additions in Bus Service on Nearly 100 Routes

body: HOUSE tours, show houses and garden tours -- each a fund-raiser for a social-service organization, school or historic preservation group -- have started at country estates, urban apartments and backyard gardens from Boston to Delaware. New York City Flatbush, Brooklyn, Sunday -- A self-guided tour of 10 Victorian residences, including a 1903 Queen
title: Touring Gardens, Homes and Estates

body: MANHATTAN DISTRICT 1 Battery Park, TriBeCa. Next meeting is April 15, 5:30 P.M.; The Regatta, Battery Park City, West Thames Street on the Esplanade; (212) 442-5050; Chairwoman: Anne Compoccia. Agenda: New skating rink on Piers 16 and 17 at South Street Seaport, transfer of municipal parking garage to private operators, citywide statement of needs,
title: Time to Tend the Grass Roots: Community Board Meetings Coming Up
